body:
This is in a cmake project,  nothing out of the ordinary. The project builds a bunch of libraries and tools. We are trying to replace the adhoc logging(mostly std::err messages).
```
#SpdLog
find_package(Spdlog REQUIRED)
include_directories(${SPDLOG_INCLUDE_DIR})
```
I mean how did you build spdlog?

Spdlog is included as a submodule(208eb0ca) and we point to the Spdlog include files using cmake variable SPDLOG_INCLUDE_DIR, using the headers only. We probably need more than just the headers I am guessing, not sure why it works fine in the debug mode though.

issue.title: Fix osx linker errors on master

repository.name: sorbet
repository.description: A fast, powerful type checker designed for Ruby

issue.body:
<!-- (optional) Explain your change, focusing on the details of the solution. This is a great place to call out user-visible changes. -->
Ensure that spdlog.h is included before fmt.h.

### Motivation
<!-- Why make this change? Describe the problem, not the solution. This can also be a link to an issue. -->
Fix master.

### Test plan
<!-- If you did not write tests for this change, replace the message below explaining why not. Why we should be confident this change is correct? If you changed the website, please include a screenshot of the proposed changes. -->

See included automated tests.

issue.title: linking error on using header only version
issue.body:
when trying to log a variable of Type:
```
typedef boost::units::quantity<boost::units::si::time, double> Time;
```
i get the followin linking error:
```
/usr/bin/ld: <file>: in function `void fmt::v5::internal::set_dynamic_spec<fmt::v5::internal::width_checker, unsigned int, fmt::v5::basic_format_context<std::back_insert_iterator<fmt::v5::internal::basic_buffer<char> >, char>, fmt::v5::internal::error_handler>(unsigned int&, fmt::v5::basic_format_arg<fmt::v5::basic_format_context<std::back_insert_iterator<fmt::v5::internal::basic_buffer<char> >, char> >, fmt::v5::internal::error_handler)':
/usr/include/spdlog/fmt/bundled/format.h:1521: undefined reference to `fmt::v5::internal::error_handler::on_error(char const*)'
/usr/bin/ld: /usr/include/spdlog/fmt/bundled/format.h:1659: undefined reference to `fmt::v5::internal::error_handler::on_error(char const*)'
/usr/bin/ld: /usr/include/spdlog/fmt/bundled/format.h:1514: undefined reference to `fmt::v5::internal::error_handler::on_error(char const*)'
/usr/bin/ld: /usr/include/spdlog/fmt/bundled/format.h:1514: undefined reference to `fmt::v5::internal::error_handler::on_error(char const*)'
/usr/bin/ld: <file>: in function `void fmt::v5::internal::set_dynamic_spec<fmt::v5::internal::precision_checker, int, fmt::v5::basic_format_context<std::back_insert_iterator<fmt::v5::internal::basic_buffer
/usr/include/spdlog/fmt/bundled/format.h:1545: undefined reference to `fmt::v5::internal::error_handler::on_error(char const*)'
/usr/bin/ld: <file>:/usr/include/spdlog/fmt/bundled/format.h:1659: more undefined references to `fmt::v5::internal::error_handler::on_error(char const*)' follow
```

body:
Hello, I still face this issue in gcc 9.3.0 / Ubuntu 20.04 and header-only spdlog (submodule, v1.x branch, current latest).
Similar to others above, in my case, I had to make sure that `spdlog.h` preceded `fmt/ostr.h` in the includes to get rid of all the linker errors.

issue.title: Update to spdlog>=1.11.0, fmt>=9.1.0.

labels.name: improvement
labels.description: Improvement / enhancement to an existing function

issue.body:
## Description
Updates to `spdlog>=1.11.0` and `fmt>=9.1.0`. Also resolves some issues with spdlog in the librmm conda packages. Thanks @robertmaynard for helping advise me on this PR.

**We need to test this downstream before merging.** Perhaps with cuML or some other library.

## Checklist
- [x] I am familiar with the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/rapidsai/rmm/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [x] New or existing tests cover these changes.
- [x] The documentation is up to date with these changes.
